body_html:
@keveman. Yes, I have successfully loaded my costumed ops to the python interpreter with the code below

my_module = tf.load_op_library(
    '/home/my_name/Tools/tensorflow/tensorflow/core/user_ops/my_ops.so'
)

Thank you very much. I already realized that I could not locate the file and did not know what was wrong. Your advice is exactly the answer.

However, another problem occurs when I run my_mudule.my_ops in with tf.Sessin():.

E tensorflow/core/framework/op_kernel.cc:867] OpKernel ('op: "Fact" device_type: "GPU"     host_memory_arg: "fact"') for unknown op: Fact
E tensorflow/core/framework/op_kernel.cc:867] OpKernel ('op: "Fact" device_type: "CPU" label:  "Sergey"') for unknown op: Fact
E tensorflow/core/framework/op_kernel.cc:867] OpKernel ('op: "Fact" device_type: "CPU" label: "sergey"') for unknown op: Fact

I did not do anything with Fact.cc or Fact.so. How can I do to resolve this error?

Again, thank you very muck for giving me advice.

body:
@keveman. Yes, I have successfully loaded my costumed ops to the python interpreter with the code below

```
my_module = tf.load_op_library(
    '/home/my_name/Tools/tensorflow/tensorflow/core/user_ops/my_ops.so'
)
```

Thank you very much. I already realized that I could not locate the file and did not know what was wrong. Your advice is exactly the answer.

However, another problem occurs when I run `my_mudule.my_ops` in `with tf.Sessin():`.

```
E tensorflow/core/framework/op_kernel.cc:867] OpKernel ('op: "Fact" device_type: "GPU"     host_memory_arg: "fact"') for unknown op: Fact
E tensorflow/core/framework/op_kernel.cc:867] OpKernel ('op: "Fact" device_type: "CPU" label:  "Sergey"') for unknown op: Fact
E tensorflow/core/framework/op_kernel.cc:867] OpKernel ('op: "Fact" device_type: "CPU" label: "sergey"') for unknown op: Fact
```

I did not do anything with _Fact.cc_ or _Fact.so_. How can I do to resolve this error?

Again, thank  you very muck for giving me advice.
